Amantadine. Amantadine is a symmetric tricyclic amine that inhibits replication of influenza A virus by impairing the function of the membrane protein M 2.
91 Present only in influenza A virus, M 2 is an acid-activated ion channel required for nucleocapsid release.
91 Amantadine is well absorbed after oral administration. It has an elimination half-life of 11 to 15 hours and is excreted by glomerular filtration and tubular secretion.
